definition: to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: Then the French came up with semi-private jails, in which the state employs only the guards;
sentences.chinese: 之后法国开始出现半私立监狱，即仅由国家雇用守卫。

sentences.english: This complex emits low pollution levels and employs many workers.
sentences.chinese: 联合企业释放低污染并且雇用很多工人。

sentences.english: She was policed by her husband's cops.
sentences.chinese: 她被丈夫雇用的警察所监视。

sentences.english: The company won a contract and hired one hundred new staff.
sentences.chinese: 公司赢得了这个合约，于是新雇用了一百名员工。

sentences.english: He was rehired after three months.
sentences.chinese: 三个月后他再一次被雇用。

sentences.english: When it comes to hiring contractors, again I will ask you to wait.
sentences.chinese: 当涉及到雇用承包商的时候，我再次请求你耐心等待。

sentences.english: A young boy who was employed by torturers saw the girl's terrible suffering.
sentences.chinese: 一个男孩，他被折磨者雇用，看到女孩可怕的遭遇。

sentences.english: They employed him as a consultant.
He also believes in lifetime employment.
sentences.chinese: 御手洗还支持员工终身雇用制。

sentences.english: It is located in the province of Papua in Indonesia near , and employs 19 500.
sentences.chinese: 它坐落在巴布亚省在印尼附近，并雇用一九五零零人。

sentences.english: Enterprises are entitled to tax cuts if employing invalids .
sentences.chinese: 雇用残疾人士的企业可以减税。

sentences.english: There is a definite shift from permanent lifetime employment to less permanent employment.
sentences.chinese: 有确切从少到永久终身雇用长工。

sentences.english: The school put on extra men to get the new building ready.
sentences.chinese: 学校为赶建新楼而额外雇用工人。

sentences.english: Ms. Khan wasn't rehired, said a person familiar with the matter.
sentences.chinese: 知情人士说，肯恩没有被重新雇用。

sentences.english: They want to hire people who are risk-takers and can make quick decisions.
sentences.chinese: 他们想雇用肯承担风险又能迅速作出决策的人。

sentences.english: Non-manufacturing business which employs more than 50 persons in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 从事非制造业而在本港雇用超过50人的企业。

definition: to hire at a high salary
